intro: Pentaphragma sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran star sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist and shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
